result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gene William Welsher

records.addlTxt: At the request of the court, the 11/11/22 final pretrial is rescheduled to 12/02/22 at 1:30.  Parties notified.  rmm

Defendant Gene William Welsher in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held.  Atty. Baltz requests a final pretrial and trial date.  Court orders any pretrial documents be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Gene William Welsher in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Case may transfer to Veteran's court, Defense counsel asks for a status. Case adjourned to Br 01.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Zachery D.W.; Kathy L.T.

Adjustment Number: 22A 054004,
Payable Number: 1012136,
Receipt Number: 22RP023312,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Gene William Welsher in court with attorney Zachary Wroblewski.  Defendant Gene William Welsher in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gene William Welsher appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
